intro: Cathcartia oliveriana, commonly known as the Oliver's cathcartia, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cathcartia oliveriana is considered a vulnerable species.
